item.title: Installing Private Packages in Docker Image - Notes
item.description: Quick notes about how to forward an ssh agent and other tricks regarding the installation of python packages. Using SSH Forwarding Exporting the $SSH_AUTH_SOCK environment variable in the image. $ docker run -rm -t -i -v $(dirname $SSH_AUTH_SOCK) -e SSH_AUTH_SOCK=$SSH_AUTH_SOCK ubuntu /bin/bash Or in the environment section of a compose file. environment: SSH_AUTH_SOCK: $SSH_AUTH_SOCK Eventual Issues with that Installing ssh in the container Adding entries to /etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts Caveats Traces of ssh keys inside the image References https://gist.
